page.title: 19B.M.X. BICYCLES, BRAYTON
page.content: The letter{BMX}stand for{Bicycle Moto {Cross.}The first{BMX}bikes were built in{1969.}They were built by a group of boys addicted to street racing on choppers. When their bikes fell apart they borrowed some welding gear and built their own bikes. Then in no time at all{BMX}tracks were built all over the world. Now things have changed slightly and you can buy bikes straight from the shops. There are two kinds of{BMX}riding -{Freestyle}which is stunts and{racing.}A{BMX course} normally consists of a {start hill} that can take up to eight racers at a time, two pairs of{whoops,}around five {berms}which are banked corners and two {step-ups.}A{step-up}is a jump that goes up the back and a pyramid that goes up 50 degrees each side. {Peter
